sentences.english: Military courts have already sentenced four men to death.
sentences.chinese: 軍事法院判處四人死罪。

sentences.english: According to the criminal law murder can be a capital offence.
sentences.chinese: 根據刑法規定，謀殺可判死罪。

sentences.english: Critical moment, commander in chief calls, exempt from Chinese fir death, to assist.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵時刻，總司令來電，免除杉木死罪，降爲少佐。

sentences.english: They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
sentences.chinese: 他們大家聚集攻擊義人，將無辜的人定爲死罪。

sentences.english: To reinstitute the death penalty review (to the high court) does not mean we will abolish capital punishment.
sentences.chinese: 重新設立死刑再審並不意味着我們將廢除死罪的處罰。

sentences.english: According to the criminal law murder can is a capital offence.
sentences.chinese: 根據刑法規定，謀殺可判死罪。

sentences.english: Do not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer, who deserves to die.
sentences.chinese: 故殺人，犯死罪的，你們不可收贖價代替他的命。

sentences.english: Crimes that can result in a death penalty are known as capital crimes or capital offences.
sentences.chinese: 最終被判死刑的犯罪通常稱爲死罪。

sentences.english: Eventually five of the nurses and the Palestinian doctor stood trial and were found guilty.
sentences.chinese: 最終五名護士和一名巴勒斯坦醫生被判死罪。

sentences.english: In fact, he was condemned to death for my sake even though he didn't deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，祂雖然不應受罰，但祂卻因我被定死罪。

sentences.english: Capital offenses ranged from gathering sticks on the Sabbath.
sentences.chinese: 死罪包括在安息日檢柴禾。

sentences.english: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
sentences.chinese: 他們大家聚集攻擊義人，將無辜的人定爲死罪。

definition: to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
to execute the whole family and confiscate their property
to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
to be punished for a crime
an execution/to put sb to death
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
